You have advantage on Constitution saving throws that you make to maintain your concentration on a spell when you take damage while casting a ritual. In addition, when you cast a wizard spell as a ritual, you can instead add a minute per spell level rather than adding 10 minutes to it.

subclassFeature.name: Compounded Hieroglyphics
entries: {@i 6th-level School of Ritualism feature}

You learn of a way to conduct a ritual that allows you to draw upon the natural arcana of your surroundings to supplant the ritual's glyphs and your magical spellbook with arcane energies. As an action, you can begin a ritual for a wizard spell in your spellbook. The spell chosen must have an instantaneous duration and its slot level can only be up to your Intelligence modifier but does not need to have the ritual tag.

When you begin the ritual, it starts as having a 1st level spell slot and you can use an action to further its progress, increasing the spell level by 1, up to your Intelligence modifier. Once the ritual reaches a spell slot level that is equivalent or greater than the chosen spell's spell slot level required to cast, you can complete the ritual as an action and unleash its spell effect without using a spell slot. In addition, you can use a bonus action to cast a 1st-level wizard spell that you have prepared without using a spell slot as long as it has an instantaneous duration, you may only perform this bonus action if you use an action for this ritual.
You can only use this feature once per long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Rewritten Rulings
entries: {@i 10th-level School of Ritualism feature}

You rewrite the formulas of spells that you have mastered. As part of you preparing your spells after a long rest, you can choose a number of spells that you have in your spell book equal to your Intelligence modifier. The spell slot level of these spells can only be up to half of your proficiency modifier. The chosen spells gain the ritual tag.

subclassFeature.name: Defied Universal Conventions
entries: {@i 14th-level School of Ritualism feature}

You cheat the natural flow of the leylines and learn how to cheapen the costs of casting magic without sacrificing any effects. Over the course of 8 hours, you can conduct a special ritual. Choose a spell in your spell book that has the ritual tag. After successfully conducting the ritual, you can cast that spell at will for the next 24 hours.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: You have superior vision in the dark and dim light as a Liberi. You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

entries.name: Liberi's Instinct
entries: You have proficiency in Stealth and Perception.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write {@language Common} and {@language Sylvan}.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light and in darkness as if it were dim light. You canâ€™t discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

entries.name: Control Water
entries: A child of the sea, you can call on the magic of mist and water. You can cast {@spell fog cloud} with this trait. Starting at 3rd level, you can cast {@spell misty step} with it, and starting at 5th level, you can also cast {@spell wall of water} with it. Once you cast a spell with this trait, you canâ€™t cast that spell with it again until you finish a long rest. Wisdom is your spellcasting ability for these spells.

entries.name: Emmisary of the Sea
entries: Aquatic beasts have an extraordinary affinity with your people. You can communicate simple ideas with beasts that can breathe water. They can understand the meaning of your words, though you have no special ability to understand them in return.

entries.name: Guardian of the Depths
entries: Adapted to even the most extreme ocean depths, you have resistance to cold damage.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write {@language Common} and {@language Primordial} (Aquan).

entries.name: Creature Type
entries: You are a Dragon.

entries.name: Draconic Ancestry
entries: You have draconic ancestry. Choose one type of dragon from the Draconic Ancestry table. Your breath weapon and damage resistance are determined by the dragon type, as shown in the table.

entries.name: Breath Weapon
entries: You can use your action to exhale destructive energy. Your draconic ancestry determines the size, shape, and damage type of the exhalation.

When you use your breath weapon, each creature in the area of the exhalation must make a saving throw, the type of which is determined by your draconic ancestry. The DC for this saving throw equals 8 + your Constitution modifier + your proficiency bonus. A creature takes {@dice 2d6} damage on a failed save, and half as much damage on a successful one. The damage increases to {@dice 3d6} at 6th level, {@dice 4d6} at 11th level, and {@dice 5d6} at 16th level.

After you use your breath weapon, you can't use it again until it's recharged. At the start of each of your turns, provided you already used your draconic breath, you may roll a d6. On a 4 or higher, you regain the use of your draconic breath. Otherwise, your draconic breath recharges 1 minute after you used it or if you spend an action to recharge it.

entries.name: Damage Resistance
entries: You have resistance to the damage type associated with your draconic ancestry.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write {@language Common} and {@language Draconic} (Saratola). While usually, the Draconic language sounds harsh to most other creatures and includes numerous hard consonants and sibilants, the Saratolan dialect of it is the direct opposite. It is more solemn and melancholic as per, from its spiritual nature.

entries.name: Languages
entries: Two main subraces of Dragonborn populate Saratola: Of The Lands, and Of The Skies. Choose one of these subraces.

entries.name: Creature Type
entries: You are a Dragon.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: Thanks to your draconic heritage, you have superior vision in dark and dim conditions. You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

entries.name: Breath Weapon
entries: You can use your action to exhale destructive energy. Your spiritual ancestry determines the size, shape, and damage type of the exhalation.

When you use your spiritual breath, each creature in the area of exhalation must make a saving throw, the type of which is determined by your draconic ancestry. The DC for this saving throw equals 8 + your Constitution modifier + your proficiency bonus. A creature takes {@dice 2d6} damage on a failed save, and half as much damage on a successful one. The damage increases by an additional 1d6 at 6th level, 11th level, and 16th level.

After you use your spiritual breath, you can't use it again until it's recharged. At the start of each of your turns, provided you already used your spiritual breath, you may roll a d6. On a 6, you regain the use of your spiritual breath. Otherwise, your spiritual breath recharges 1 minute after you used it.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write {@language Common} and {@language Draconic} (Saratola). While usually, the Draconic language sounds harsh to most other creatures and includes numerous hard consonants and sibilants, the Saratolan dialect of it is the direct opposite. It is more solemn and melancholic as per, from its spiritual nature.

entries.name: Spiritual Ancestry
entries: While the dragonborn reflect more on their draconic ancestry, the drakensoul follows either the path of the Four Guardians of Saratola which are Baihu the White, Qinglong the Green, Xuanwu the Blue, and Zhuque the Red or the Heavenly Twins, Huanglong and Qilin. Each one representing Saratola's link to the Elemes Giga-Cosmos or the Fey and Fell Cosmos, in the case of the Heavenly Twins.

Your breath weapon deals elemental damage of the type associated with your chosen subrace, and you are resistant to the damage type associated with it. In addition, your ability scores increase as described, and you gain an additional draconic trait.

entries.name: Creature Type
entries: You are a Fey.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: Thanks to your draconic heritage, you have superior vision in dark and dim conditions. You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

entries.name: Powerful Build
entries: You count as one size larger when determining your carrying capacity and the weight you can push, drag, or lift.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write {@language Common} and {@language Sylvan} (Yokai). The Yokai's speech retains the playful tones of the fey but instill to it a sort of wise and foreboding air to it.

entries.name: Creature Type
entries: You are a Fey.

entries.name: Tengu's Speed
entries: You have a walking speed of 40 and at 3rd level, you gain a pair of elemental wings that you can use to fly with.

entries.name: Mountain Born
entries: You have resistance to cold damage. You're also acclimated to high altitude, including elevations above 20,000 feet.

entries.name: Walking Tempest
entries: You know the {@spell gust|XGE} cantrip. Once you reach 3rd level, you can cast the expeditious retreat spell; you must finish a long rest in order to cast the spell again using this trait. Once you reach 5th level, you can also cast the {@spell gust of wind} spell; you must finish a long rest in order to cast the spell again using this trait. Wisdom is your spellcasting ability for these spells.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write {@language Common} and {@language Sylvan} (Yokai). The Yokai's speech retains the playful tones of the fey but instill to it a sort of wise and foreboding air to it.

entries.name: Creature Type
entries: You are an Elemental. You are also considered a Fey for any prerequisite or effect that requires you to be a Fey.

entries.name: Shy Spirits
entries: As an action, wildersouls can hide and replace the physical traits that are common for their kind such as the vulpine features of a kitsune, carapace and dish of a kappa, weasel-like features of a kamaitachi, and the horns of a kudan. By using this feature, wildersouls can appear as a normal human or adopt more particular physical traits such as pointy ears, colored sclera, long-flowing hair and beards, and et cetera.
This is counted as an illusion with a spell slot level equal to your proficiency bonus but is not considered as a spell effect for the purposes of dispelling and identifying.

entries.name: Kinship By Blood
entries: A wildersoul will always know if a creature that they can see is a wildersoul as long as they belong to the same subrace.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write {@language Common} and {@language Sylvan} (Yokai). The Yokai's speech retains the playful tones of the fey but instill to it a sort of wise and foreboding air to it.

entries.name: Creature Type
entries: You are a Fey.

entries.name: Living Tool
entries: Being a tsukumogami, your original form is of a tool. This can either be a trinket, tool, artisan's tools, or a weapon of your choice.

As an action, you can transform back to your original form or your humanoid form. While in your original form, you retain all of your statistics and proficiencies. Your hit points instead becomes 5 times your character level and you have an AC of 10. You revert to your humanoid form if you are knocked unconscious as a result of dropping to 0 hit points, any excess damage carries over to your humanoid form.
You can't cast spells and any actions that requires hands is prohibited while in your original form but you retain your ability to speak and all of your special senses.
You choose whether your equipment falls to the ground in your space or merges into your new form.
At 7th level, you become a +1 variant of your original form when transforming into it which increases to a +2 at 11th, and a +3 at 15th.
You can transform into your original form twice per long rest.

entries.name: Function Over Form
entries: You gain proficiency for the object chosen as your original form. Items that are neither a tool or a weapon are treated as an improvised weapon.
If your original form is a tool, your proficiency bonus is doubled for any ability check you make using it.
If your original form is a weapon, you can use the chosen weapon as your unarmed strikes.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write {@language Common} and {@language Sylvan} (Yokai). The Yokai's speech retains the playful tones of the fey but instill to it a sort of wise and foreboding air to it.

entries.name: Ability Score Increase
entries: Two different ability scores of your choice increase by 1. Instead of increasing two different ability scores, you can instead choose to increase one ability score by 2.

entries.name: Prodigy
entries: You start out with the {@feat prodigy|xge} racial feat.

entries.name: Liberi's Intelligence
entries: When you move on your turn in combat, you can double your speed until the end of the turn. Once you use this trait, you can't use it again until you move 0 feet on one of your turns.

entries.name: Liberi's Cunning
entries: You have advantage on all Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma saving throws against magic.

entries.name: Bellua Evolution
entries: You gain one {@filter feat|feats|source=phb;tce;xge;bgg;ftd;mtf;ass;bmt|ability bonus=str} of your choice as long as the chosen feat increases your Strength score by 1. Additionally, when you jump, you can extend your jump by a number of feet equal to your Strength modifier.

entries.name: Piscine Evolution
entries: You have a walking speed of 35 and additionally, you gain a swimming speed and flying speed equal to your walking speed.

entries.name: Woeful White
entries: Your breath weapon deals magical bludgeoning damage in a 15-foot cone as a torrent of rocks manifest alongside your spiritual breath. Your breath weapon imposes a Dexterity saving throw. On a failure, a creature that is Large or smaller is knocked prone. The area affected in your spiritual breath is turned into difficult terrain.

entries.name: Resistant and Withstanding
entries: When you aren't wearing armor, your AC is 13 + your Constitution modifier. You can use your natural armor to determine your AC if the armor you wear would leave you with a lower AC. A shield's benefits apply as normal while you use your natural armor.

entries.name: Grieving Green
entries: Your breath weapon deals magical force damage in a line 30 feet long and 5 feet wide as gusts of wind blow alongside your spiritual breath. Your breath weapon imposes a Constitution saving throw. Choose a number of creatures equal to your Wisdom modifier, they instead regain hit points equal to the total amount of damage that your breath weapon will deal.

entries.name: Wise and Learnt
entries: You know one cantrip of your choice from the wizard spell list. Intelligence is your spellcasting ability for it.

entries.name: Baleful Blue
entries: Your breath weapon deals magical cold damage in a line 30 feet long and 5 feet wide as shards of sharpened ice fly alongside your spiritual breath. Your breath weapon imposes a Dexterity saving throw. You add double your Constitution modifier to the damage of your spiritual breath.

entries.name: Bold and Sinister
entries: You gain proficiency in the Intimidation skill. You have advantage on saving throws against being charmed or frightened.

entries.name: Raging Red
entries: Your breath weapon deals magical fire damage in a 15-foot cone as a torment of fire blows alongside your spiritual breath. Your breath weapon imposes a Constitution saving throw. On a failure, a creature takes damage equal to half of your Constitution modifier (rounded up) at the start of their turn as flames begin to alight their body. That creature or one within 5 ft. of it can use their action to douse the flames.

entries.name: Resolute and Skilled
entries: You gain proficiency in simple weapons and two martial weapons of your choice. Your hit point maximum increases by 1, and it increases by 1 every time you gain a level.

entries.name: Feywild's Command
entries: Your breath weapon deals magical radiant damage in a line 30 feet long and 5 feet wide as the mysticism of the Feywild lends its strength to your spiritual breath. Your breath weapon imposes a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a creature is blinded until the end of their next turn as the light of the Feywild covers the creatureâ€™s eyes.

entries.name: Watcher of the Feywild
entries: You can cast {@spell detect magic} at will, without expending a spell slot.

entries.name: Shadowfell's Command
entries: Your breath weapon deals magical necrotic damage in a 15-foot cone as the mysticism of the Shadowfell lends its strength to your spiritual breath. Your breath weapon imposes a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature is blinded until the end of their next turn as the darkness of the Shadowfell obstructs the creatureâ€™s eyes.

entries.name: Watcher of the Shadowfell
entries: The range of your darkvision is increased by 60 feet. In addition to this, you have blindsense with a range of 15 feet. Within that range, you can effectively see anything that isn't behind total cover, even if you're blinded or in darkness. Moreover, you can see an invisible creature within that range, unless the creature successfully hides from you.

entries.name: Relentless Endurance
entries: When you are reduced to 0 hit points but not killed outright, you can drop to 1 hit point instead. You can't use this feature again until you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Heavy-Handed
entries: Your unarmed strikes deal bludgeoning damage equal to 1d6 + your Strength modifier, instead of the normal bludgeoning damage for an unarmed strike.

entries.name: Oni Weapon Training
entries: You have proficiency in all martial and simple melee weapons that have the Two-Handed and Heavy properties.

entries.name: Shadow Magic
entries: As a reaction to being attacked, you may shift into a shadowy version of yourself. You force a reroll on the attack and afterwards you may teleport to an area in dim light or darkness up to 60 ft. away from yourself. Once you use this ability, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Blending With The Night
entries: While in dim light or darkness, you can use a bonus action to become invisible until the start of your next turn, you make an attack, cast a spell, deal damage, or force a creature to make a saving throw. You can use this bonus action a number of times equal to your proficiency modifier.

entries.name: Shapechanger
entries: As an action, you can change your appearance and your voice. You determine the specifics of the changes, including your coloration, hair length, and sex. You can also adjust your height and weight, but not so much that your size changes. You can make yourself appear as a member of another race, though none of your game statistics change. You canâ€™t duplicate the appearance of a creature youâ€™ve never seen, and you must adopt a form that has the same basic arrangement of limbs that you have. Your clothing and equipment arenâ€™t changed by this trait.
You stay in the new form until you use an action to revert to your true form or until you die.

entries.name: Superior Darkvision
entries: You have superior vision in dark and dim conditions. You can see in dim light within 120 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

entries.name: Tempered Breeze
entries: You gain proficiency in an artisan's tools of your choice and you additionally gain proficiency in simple weapons.

entries.name: Swirling Tempest
entries: Starting at 3rd level, you can use your action to unleash your elemental strength and unfurl your wings.
Your transformation lasts for 1 minute or until you end it as a bonus action. During it, you have a flying speed equal to your walking speed that is doubled if you are outdoors in windy conditions.
Once you use this trait, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Dai Weapon Training
entries: You have proficiency in greatswords, longswords, rapiers, scimitars, and shortswords.

entries.name: Booming Tempest
entries: Starting at 3rd level, you can use your action to unleash your elemental strength and unfurl your wings.

Your transformation lasts for 1 minute or until you end it as a bonus action. During it, you have a flying speed equal to your walking speed that is doubled if you are outdoors in stormy conditions, and once on each of your turns, you can deal extra lightning damage to one target when you deal damage to it with an attack or a spell. The extra lightning damage equals your level.
Once you use this trait, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Calming Presence
entries: You gain proficiency in one of the following skills: Deception, Intimidation, Performance, or Persuasion. Additionally, you learn one language of your choice and you gain proficiency in an instrument of your choice.

entries.name: Cumulus Tempest
entries: Starting at 3rd level, you can use your action to unleash your elemental strength and unfurl your wings.

Your transformation lasts for 1 minute or until you end it as a bonus action. During it, you have a flying speed equal to your walking speed. At the start of your turn, you gain temporary hit points equal to five times your proficiency bonus.
Once you use this trait, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Kitsune's Charm and Cunning
entries: You learn the {@spell friends} cantrip. Additionally, you gain proficiency with one of the following skills of your choice: Deception, Intimidation, Performance, or Persuasion.

entries.name: Foxfire
entries: You learn the {@spell produce flame} cantrip. As a reaction to yourself dealing fire damage, you can cause all creatures and objects that took fire damage to be burnt by a lingering ember (typically a light shade of blue). At the start of their next turn, the embers torch the creature, dealing fire damage equal to your Charisma modifier.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Shy Spirits: Kitsune
entries: You can only alter your appearance through this feature if your vulpine traits are well-groomed. While disguised, it is undone if your rear is drenched in water, or if it is affected by a strong wind capable of extinguishing flames.

entries.name: Kappa's Knowledge and Strength
entries: You gain proficiency in the Medicine and Athletics skills if you don't already have it. Your proficiency bonus is doubled for any ability check you make that uses either of those proficiencies.

entries.name: Child of the River
entries: You have a tough carapace on your back. When you aren't wearing armor, your base AC is 13 + your Dexterity modifier. You can use your natural armor to determine your AC if the armor you wear would leave you with a lower AC. A shield's benefits apply as normal while you use your natural armor.

Additionally, you have a cap on your head filled with water called a sara. If your dish spills all of its contents (by being knocked unconscious and et cetera), you suffer one level of exhaustion. Each time you finish a long rest without a water-filled dish on your head, you suffer one level of exhaustion. You can recover from this exhaustion only through magic or by refilling the dish and placing it back atop your head. If you lose the dish, you can use any suitable substitute which would then transform into your natural dish after 1 hour.

entries.name: Shy Spirits: Kappa
entries: You can only alter your appearance through this feature if your sara is filled to the brim with water. While disguised, it is undone if the top of your head is in a position wherein your sara would typically empty its contents.

entries.name: Kamaitachi's Sharpness and Havoc
entries: You have two natural weapons that you can emerge from your limbs as a short sickle-like blade as a bonus action. It deals 1d6 slashing damage on a hit and has the Finesse and Light properties. When making an attack using the natural weapon, you can make one additional weapon attack with it as part of that action. Additionally, you gain proficiency in the Martial skill.

entries.name: Dust Sickles
entries: You learn the {@spell dust devil|XGE} spell and can cast it once without expending a spell slot or using a material component. Casting it this way instead pulls creature into the center of the vortex and the spell deals slashing damage instead of bludgeoning damage. As long as you are within 30 feet of the spell, you can target any creatures within the vortex using your natural weapons. You regain the ability to cast it in this way when you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Shy Spirits: Kamaitachi
entries: You can only alter your appearance through this feature if your sickles are sharp and without any cracks or breaks. While disguised, it is undone if the top of your head is in a position wherein your sara would typically empty its contents.

entries.name: Kudan's Foresight and Warding
entries: You gain proficiency in any Mental skill of your choice and yourÂ proficiency bonus is doubled for any ability check that makes use of the proficiency. When you finish a long rest, you can change what Mental skill you have proficiency for and you also know what type of weather it will be within 1 mile for the next 24 hours.

entries.name: Prophecy
entries: When you finish a long rest, roll a d20 and record the numbers rolled. You can replace any attack roll, saving throw, or ability check made by you or a creature that you can see with one of these foretelling rolls. You must choose to do so before the roll, and you can replace a roll in this way only once per turn.
Each foretelling roll can be used only once. When you finish a long rest, you lose any unused foretelling rolls.

feat.name: Arcane Brawn
entries: Choose a class that you have levels in and that has either the Spellcasting or Pact Magic feature. Your spellcasting modifier for that class becomes Strength and any class feature coming from the same class that is based on the same ability modifier also is now based on Strength.
Only full casting classes and Warlocks are eligible for this feat.

feat.name: Astute Caster
entries: You have a number of Extemporaneous Spells equal to your proficiency bonus for a spell list that you choose when you take this feat. Extemporaneous spells count as part of your prepared spell list but you may only cast them once until prepared again as an extemporaneous spell. You prepare your extemporaneous spells as part of your short rest.

feat.name: Bodyguard
entries: You strived to develop various techniques and you honed your reflexes in order to safeguard your allies. You gain the following benefits:

items: As a reaction to an allied creature that you can see within half of your movement range being targeted by an attack, you may rush towards them and take their place, moving them to an adjacent unoccupied space of their choice. You have resistance to all damage dealt by the prerequisite attack. Until the start of your ally's turn, any attacks targeting them is focused on you instead. You cannot make this reaction if there are no unoccupied spaces around your ally except if you are already occupying a space adjacent to them.

feat.name: Butched
entries: You've learned how to best take down your opponents by absolutely obliterating their weakest point. You gain the following benefits:

items: Your weapon attack rolls are only critical hits if the roll is 20 or your attack is guaranteed to be a critical hit. In return, you roll your weapon's damage dice an additional time when you land a critical hit, an additional time for each increase of critical hit threshold.

feat.name: Butcher
entries: You are a butcher in the battlefield, all your enemies are mere cattle to your blade. You gain the following benefits:

items: Your critical hit range when making weapon attacks is increased by 1.

feat.name: Clear Mind

otherSummary.entry: Be able to cast and prepare spells.

entries: Choose a class that you have levels in and that has either the Spellcasting or Pact Magic feature. You increase the amount of spells you can prepare or know for that class by a number equal to your proficiency bonus.
You can select this feat multiple times but only once for each class.

feat.name: Diverse Styles
entries: You learn how to develop your fighting style in a more non-linear way. Choose a combat archetype that you have not chosen as your starting combat archetype and gain its benefits.

feat.name: Greater Diverse Styles
entries: You learn how to further develop your fighting style in a more non-linear way. Choose a tier two specialization of one of your combat archetypes and gain its benefits.

feat.name: Enhanced Lungs
entries: Extensive training has granted you greater control over your Breath Weapon, allowing you to enhance its power and speed.

items: Your breath weapon refresh rate is increased by 1. If you have a breath weapon that requires rest to recharge, it gains a recharge of 6.
You gain empower points equal to double your proficiency bonus. Each time you use your breath weapon you may expend an empower point and choose one of the following benefits:
You may use your breath weapon as a bonus action.
You may increase the damage of your breath weapon by 2d6.
Your breath weapon's range is doubled.
Your breath weapon's range is changed into either a 15-foot cone, a 30-foot long line that is 5-foot wide, or a 10-foot radius centered on you.
You may only gain each benefit once per use of your breath weapon, but you may gain multiple different benefits at once.
You regain two empower points after finishing a short rest, and all of them after finishing a long rest.

feat.name: Grappler (Lolzdux)
entries: You've developed the skills necessary to hold your own in close-quarters grappling. You gain the following benefits:

items: You have advantage on attack rolls against a creature you are grappling and you have advantage on Athletics checks made to grapple a prone creature.
You can use your action to try to pin a creature grappled by you. To do so, make another grapple check. If you succeed, you and the creature are both restrained until the grapple ends.
You are considered one size larger for the purposes of grappling, and shoving.
You no longer move at half speed when grappling a target of the same size or smaller as you.

Whenever you attempt to grapple as part of your Attack action, you may use your bonus action to shove. Whenever you attempt to shove as part of your Attack action, you may use your bonus action to grapple.

feat.name: Hellbound Bravado
entries: Whether it be courage or foolishness, you rush into combat headfirst and abandoning safety. The blood pumping in your veins, filled with adrenaline, is the greatest armor and weapon that you have. You gain the following benefits:

items: Permanently increase your Strength score by 2, regardless of the maximum limit.
While you're raging, you take double damage from all sources.
After a long rest, your first 5 uses of Relentless Rage does not require or increase the Constitution saving throw made for it.

feat.name: Mischievous Miracles
entries: Whether it be a divine gift or the unknown forces that be, the very will of the world seems to follow the whims of your words, granting you the following benefits:

items: You learn the {@spell thaumaturgy} cantrip. You can cast it without verbal components, and you learn a few new ways on how to use it:
You can make any willing creature's voice booms up to three times as loud as normal for 1 minute instead of your own. If the creature is unwilling, they are subjected to an Intelligence saving throw.
You can create sounds that last up to 12 seconds from a point of your choice within range.
You can attempt to pick locks within range. This is a Sleight of Hand check using the ability score by this feat.
You can immediately trigger traps within range.
Additionally, you can have up to five of its 1-minute effects active at a time instead of three.

You can cast the {@spell command} spell, requiring no spell slot or components, and you must finish a long rest before you can cast it this way again. Your spellcasting ability for the spell is the ability increased by this feat. You can also cast these spells using spell slots you have of the appropriate level.

feat.name: Power Walker
entries: You have a large stride and you have the stamina to maintain that pace. You gain the following benefits:

items: Your speed increases by 5 feet.
Once per long rest, you suffer no downsides after your first time travelling at a faster pace.

feat.name: Stormcaller's Wrath

otherSummary.entry: Barbarian (Path of the Storm Herald Lolzdux)

entries: Your mastery of the storm reaches an even greater height. You gain the following benefits:

items: Permanently increase your Constitution score by 2, regardless of the maximum limit.
When beginning your rage, you may choose a different natural disaster to manifest. Your Storm Soul feature would stay the same.
Your storm aura's radius is increased to 30 feet.
You ignore the first levels of exhaustion you would take from your transformative rage through the Avatar of the Storm feature. You must complete a long rest before you are able to do so again.

feat.name: Crushing Violence
entries: When you deal damage to a creature that has no resistances to bludgeoning damage, they take rupture damage equal to your proficiency bonus. A creature can only take this damage once per turn.

feat.name: Taunting Violence
entries: When you deal damage to a creature that has no resistances to piercing damage, they reduce all of their damage rolls on their next turn by a number equal to your proficiency bonus.

feat.name: Lingering Violence
entries: When you deal damage to a creature that has no resistances to slashing damage, they take bleed damage equal to your proficiency bonus. A creature can only take this damage once per turn.

feat.name: Battlemage Myrmidon
entries: In the battlefield you weave together both swords and spellsÂ into destructive harmonies, you gain the following benefits:

items: You become eligible for learning all smite spells and blade cantrips, regardless of class restriction.

You learn the {@spell battlemage hand|ASS} spell which you can cast without expending a spell slot once per short rest. You can also cast the spell using spell slots you have of the appropriate level. The spell's spellcasting ability is the ability increased by this feat.
While the {@spell battlemage hand|ASS} spell is active, attacks you make using the hand deals rupture damage equal to half your proficiency bonus.

entries: Only full casting classes and Warlocks are eligible for this feat.

optionalfeature.name: Enhanced Casting
entries: When you damage a creature with a spell or a spell attack, you may deal extra damage equal to your spellcasting modifier. You may only deal this extra damage once per turn. Your spell save DC and spell attack bonus each increases by 1.

optionalfeature.name: Focused Catalyst (FOC-X)
entries: You increase your critical hit threshold for your spell attacks by 1. When you roll a 20 on a spell attack, you can roll two additional damage dice when determining the extra damage the target takes.

optionalfeature.name: Explosive Catalyst (EXP-X)
entries: When you cast a spell that requires a saving throw to mitigate damage, you can add a mental ability score modifier of your choice to the damage rolls.

optionalfeature.name: Binding Catalyst (BIN-X)
entries: When you cast a spell that only gives a creature a condition or debilitates them in some way, you increase the DC to circumvent the effect by a number equal to half of your proficiency bonus. If the spell would also deal damage, you can opt to remove the damage to gain the effect of this feature.

optionalfeature.name: Efficient Catalyst (EFF-X)
entries: Once per long rest, you can cast a spell using your highest level spell slot without expending a spell slot.

optionalfeature.name: Feedback Loop Catalyst (FLP-X)
entries: As an action, you can expend one of your spell slots to enhance your spellcasting for 1 minute. You gain a +1 bonus to your spellcasting modifier which increases by 1 for every three slots above 1st. Using this action while the effects are still ongoing only refreshes the duration or replaces the effect if the new bonus is higher than the ongoing one.

optionalfeature.name: Shielding Catalyst (SLD-X)
entries: Whenever you cast a spell, you have the benefits of the Shield spell for 1 round.

optionalfeature.name: Alternating Catalyst (ALT-X)
entries: Whenever you cast a spell that requires a saving throw to mitigate its effects, you gain a +2 bonus to your spell attack rolls on the next turn. Whenever you cast a spell that requires a spell attack roll, you gain a +2 bonus to your spell save DC on the next turn. You can only gain these benefits once per turn.

optionalfeature.name: Assiting Catalyst (ASS-X)
entries: After ending your turn while concentrating on a spell, you can cast one of your cantrips at its base level.

optionalfeature.name: Dryspell Catalyst (DRY-X)
entries: You gain a new way to cast spells. When casting a spell that has a casting time of an action and has an instantaneous duration, you can instead concentrate on it for a greater effect. The target (location or creature) must first be specified before concentrating on the spell. If at the end of your turn, the spell has not yet been ended, the spell slot level of the spell increases by 1 (up to your proficiency bonus). When the spell ends, either because your concentration is broken or because you decide to end it, the effects of the spell take place. This feature can only be used when casting a spell using a spell slot up to half of your proficiency bonus.

optionalfeature.name: Defensive Measures
entries: Your hit point maximum increases by an amount equal to your level. Whenever you gain a level thereafter, your hit point maximum increases by an additional 1 hit point. You gain an additional hit die for a class every 2 levels invested into it.

optionalfeature.name: Fortress (FO-X)
entries: You reduce any damage you take by an amount equal to your proficiency bonus. As an action, you can take on a defensive stance. Instead of taking the Dodge action, you instead double all of your sources of damage reduction.

optionalfeature.name: Fortress (FO-Y)
entries: As a bonus action, you can take on a defensive stance if you haven't moved during this turn. You expend a hit die and reduce any damage taken equal to the rolled die + your Constitution modifier and your speed is 0 until the start of your next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Sanctuary (SN-X)
entries: As a bonus action, you can heal yourself or an ally within 15 feet of you by expending a hit die. The target regains hit points equal to the rolled die + your Constitution modifier.

optionalfeature.name: Sanctuary (SN-Y)
entries: As a bonus action, you can heal yourself or an ally within 15 feet of you by expending a hit die. The target regains hit points at the start of their turn equal to your hit die. This effect lasts for a number equal to your proficiency bonus and further expedition only refreshes the duration.

optionalfeature.name: Haven (HV-X)
entries: You add half of your proficiency bonus in saving throws that you are not proficient in. As a reaction to an ally within 15 feet of you being forced to roll a saving throw, you can add your proficiency bonus to the resulting roll, you can perform this reaction before or after the saving throw has been made, but before any of the effects have been applied.

optionalfeature.name: Haven (HV-Y)
entries: When you are subjected to an effect that allows you to make a saving throw to take only half damage, you instead take no damage if you succeed on the saving throw, and only half damage if you fail. As a reaction to succeeding a saving throw, you may expend a hit die. Any creatures of your choice that is subjected to the same regains hit points equal to the rolled die + your Constitution modifier and they can reroll their saving throw and choose which outcome to take.

optionalfeature.name: Labyrinth (LB-X)
entries: At the start of your turn, choose a number of creatures equal to your proficiency bonus within 30 feet of you, you force the targets to make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, any attacks or similar actions that they make will be targeted on you. This effect lasts until the start of your next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Labyrinth (LB-Y)
entries: You gain the Interception fighting style. You no longer need to use your reaction and you do not require any equipment to intercept attacks. Additionally, the results of Interception is doubled but you take half of the original damage dealt.

optionalfeature.name: Guard Training
entries: You learn one {@filter Fighting Style|optionalfeatures|feature type=fs:f} option of your choice from the fighter class. If you already have a style, the one you choose must be different.

optionalfeature.name: Sweeper (SW-X)
entries: When you make a weapon attack, you can make another attack with the same weapon against a different creature that is within 5 feet of the original target and within range of your weapon as part of the Attack action.

optionalfeature.name: Duelist (DU-X)
entries: As a bonus action, you can mark a creature within 15 feet of you. This mark lasts until the end of your next turn. Whenever you make a weapon attack against a marked target, they take an additional 1d6 damage and your critical hit range is increased by 3. You can use this feature a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, regaining all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Relentless (RE-X)
entries: Whenever you land a melee weapon attack, you regain hit points equal to your proficiency bonus. This bonus is doubled on a critical hit.

optionalfeature.name: Opportunist (OP-X)
entries: As an action, you may enter a defensive stance. In this defensive stance, whenever a creature misses an attack roll against you, make a melee weapon attack against them provided that you can reach the creature, this is counted as an attack of opportunity but does not use your reaction.

optionalfeature.name: Au Naturel (AN-X)
entries: When you take the Attack action and only make melee attacks using your unarmed strikes or a natural weapon, you may make an additional attack using either as part of that action. If that attack hits, the target takes an extra 1d8 damage of the weapon's damage type. While you are not wearing armor, you gain a bonus to your armor class and saving throws equal to half of your proficiency bonus.

optionalfeature.name: Zoner (ZN-X)
entries: When you make a melee attack to a creature that is not adjacent to you, your critical hit range for that attack is increased by 1.

optionalfeature.name: Conclusive (CL-X)
entries: As a full-time action, you can make a Conclusive Strike. When making a Conclusive Strike, you are limited to only that one attack until the start of your next turn. The Conclusive Strike is treated as if it were a normal weapon attack but you instead use the highest number possible for each of the damage rolls.

optionalfeature.name: Striker (ST-X)
entries: After every two attack rolls, the next attack roll made gains a bonus to the attack and damage rolls equal to your proficiency bonus.

optionalfeature.name: Advanced Medical Procedures
entries: Any healing that you apply is increased by your proficiency bonus.

optionalfeature.name: High Quality Prescriptions (HQP-X)
entries: Whenever you heal a creature, the healing is increased by 2d8 + a mental ability score modifier of your choice. This effect may only occur once per turn.

optionalfeature.name: High Quality Prescriptions (HQP-X)
entries: Whenever you heal a creature, the healing is increased by 2d8 + a mental ability score modifier of your choice. This effect may only occur once per turn.

optionalfeature.name: High Quality Prescriptions (HQP-Y)
entries: Whenever you heal a creature, you grant them a 1d6 that they can use for any attack roll, ability check, or saving throw that they make. They also gain a bonus to their armor class and damage rolls equal to your proficiency bonus. This benefit lasts only for a number of turns equal to your proficiency bonus and once the die has been rolled, all of these benefits are lost.

optionalfeature.name: Duplicitous Doctor (DUD-X)
entries: Whenever you heal a creature, another creature of your choice within 30 feet other than the original target regains hit points equal to 1d10 + a mental ability score modifier of your choice. This effect may only occur once per turn.

optionalfeature.name: Beacon of Health (BOH-X)
entries: The range of any healing effect that you have is tripled. If it is an effect with a reach of touch or 5 feet, the range is increased to 30 feet.

optionalfeature.name: Beacon of Health (BOH-Y)
entries: The range of any healing effect that you have now has a long range that is double of its original range. When healing a creature below your long range, the healing is increased by 1d8 + a mental ability score modifier of your choice. This effect may only occur once per turn.

optionalfeature.name: Overprotective Parent (OPP-X)
entries: When healing a creature, any regained hit points above their maximum is converted into temporary hit points that lasts for a number of rounds equal to your proficiency bonus.

optionalfeature.name: Overprotective Parent (OPP-Y)
entries: You can spend 10 minutes pampering a companion. When you do so, one friendly creature of your choice adjacent to you gains temporary hit points equal to your character level multiplied by your proficiency bonus. You may only use this feature once per dawn and the temporary hit points granted lasts for 8 hours.

optionalfeature.name: Harm-Assisting Harmacist (HAH-X)
entries: As an action, you can concentrate for a large blast of power for 1 minute or until you lose your concentration (as if you were concentrating on a spell).

You have a pool of damage that accumulates as you concentrate. In subsequent turns as you maintain concentration, the additional healing that you apply from Advanced Medical Procedures is disabled but whenever you heal a creature, you add half of the hit points regained into your pool.

As an action, you can unleash this effect and end your concentration on it, in doing so, you may divide the pool accumulated among any number of creatures within 60 feet of you and they take damage accordingly.
You can only use this feature once per long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Harm-Assisting Harmacist (HAH-Y)
entries: When healing above a creature's maximum hit points, you deal damage to creatures of your choice adjacent to the target. This damage is equal to any excess hit points healed above its hit point maximum.

optionalfeature.name: Sniper Training
entries: You gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls you make with ranged weapons.

optionalfeature.name: Anti-Air (AA-X)
entries: Whenever you would make a ranged attack roll against a target that is using its flying speed or a similar effect (such as Levitation), the attack would automatically hit except when you would roll a 1 on the attack roll.

optionalfeature.name: Opening Salvo (OS-X)
entries: The first time you would take the Attack action in combat, you may make additional ranged weapon attacks as part of it. The amount of additional attacks that you can make is equal to your proficiency bonus.

optionalfeature.name: CQC Expert (CQ-X)
entries: Being within 5 feet of a hostile creature doesn't impose disadvantage on your ranged attack rolls. You would also gain a bonus to your attack and damage rolls equal to half of your proficiency bonus whenever you would make a ranged weapon attack against a target within 15 feet of you.

optionalfeature.name: Eagle-Eyed (EE-X)
entries: You gain the {@feat Sharpshooter} feat. In addition to that, the range of all of your ranged weaponry and your senses are doubled. You also gain advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

optionalfeature.name: Golden Zone (GZ-X)
entries: At the end of a long rest, choose a cardinal direction (North, West, South, East). Any ranged weapon attacks that you make within 45Â° of the chosen direction has an attack roll bonus equal to half of your proficiency bonus and deals an extra 1d6 to the target.

optionalfeature.name: Crowd Control (CC-X)
entries: Whenever you deal ranged weapon damage on a large area and it requires a saving throw to mitigate, you now always deal full damage to targets on a failed save and half damage to targets on a successful save. Additionally, the saving throw required for the effect now has its DC increased by your proficiency bonus.

optionalfeature.name: Circus Act (CA-X)
entries: You gain the Thrown Weapon Fighting fighting style. Additionally, anything that you throw now counts as an attack using a ranged weapon that you have proficiency with and additionally as a melee weapon attack.

optionalfeature.name: Cover Shooter (CS-X)
entries: Your ranged weapon attacks ignore half cover and three-quarters cover. If your target is covered by a friendly creature, your attack and damage rolls are increased by 1. If you are behind Â¾ cover, your attack and damage rolls are increased by 1.

optionalfeature.name: Extended Support
entries: You can use your bonus action to either aid or hinder any creature of your choosing within 30 feet of you. Choose one of the following effects:

items: {@b {@i Aid Offense.}} Roll a 1d6. The targeted creature can add the result to an attack roll, damage roll, or ability check.
{@b {@i Aid Defense.}} Roll a 1d6. The targeted creature can add the result to a saving throw, or to their AC when they are hit.
{@b {@i Hinder Offense.}} Roll a 1d4. The next attack roll that the targeted creature would make is reduced by the result.
{@b {@i Hinder Defense.}} Roll a 1d4. The next time the targeted creature is targeted by an attack roll or is forced to make a saving throw, reduce their AC or their saving throw by the result.

entries: Creatures may only be affected by these effects once per round and it only lasts until the start of your next turn.
You can only use this feature a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus and you regain all uses on a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Jack of All Trades, Master of None (JM-X)
entries: Each time you would use your Extended Support archetype feature, you can choose an additional creature to be affected by it. Additionally, each of the effects is improved and the die rolled is increased by one more level (1d4 -> 1d6, 1d6 -> 1d8).

items: {@b {@i Bolster Offense.}} If the die is used to increase an attack roll or a damage roll, add it to the resulting damage roll for the attack. If the die is used to increase an ability check, add half of the roll to the result.
{@b {@i Bolster Defense.}} You and the supported creature gain temporary hit points equal to double of the resulting roll.
{@b {@i Debilitate Offense.}}  If the attack would still succeed, the damage roll is reduced by double the resulting roll.

{@b {@i Debilitate Defense.}} If the die is used to reduce a creature's AC, increase the critical hit threshold of the attack by half of the result. If the die is used to reduce the creature's saving throw, reduce it again by half of the result.

optionalfeature.name: Militia General (MG-X)
entries: At the beginning of combat and as an action, you can freely swap around your and willing allied creatures' initiative order with other willing allied creatures. For example, if Creature A has a 19 in initiative and Creature B has a 4, you can have Creature B take the 19 instead and Creature A takes the 4 if they are willing.

optionalfeature.name: Battlefield Sovereign (BS-X)
entries: As an action, you can specify a point within 120 feet of you, an area of focus is evoked centered in that point extending 30 feet in every direction. Creatures of your choice in that area can increase forced movement effects by up to 15 feet and they also suffer no movement penalty when grappling a creature. Creatures of your choice will walk through that area as if it was difficult terrain. This area lasts for 1 minute or until you use this feature again.

optionalfeature.name: Kingpin (KP-X)
entries: Creatures that you control have increased maximum hit points equal to your character level. Their attack rolls, damage rolls, and saving throws are increased by your proficiency bonus and should they force a target to roll a saving throw, you can use your reaction to increase the DC by a number equal to your proficiency bonus.

optionalfeature.name: Condition Expert (CD-X)
entries: Choose a creature within 60 feet of you, you can use an action to lengthen an effect that they have by another round or grant them disadvantage on the saving throw made to remove the effect.

optionalfeature.name: Vanguard Rush
entries: Your speed increases by 10 feet. You also have a bonus to your initiative equal to half of your proficiency bonus (rounded up). At the first turn of combat, you can use your bonus action to Dash.

optionalfeature.name: Adrenaline
entries: You gain a resource called Adrenaline. At the start of combat, you have 0. Your options for gaining Adrenaline varies according to your specialization and they can be used for temporary buffs at the start of your turn which are the following:

items: {@b {@i Athlete (2).}} Climbing doesnâ€™t cost you extra movement and your jumping distance is tripled.
{@b {@i Cunning Action (3).}} You can take the Dash, Disengage, or Hide action as a bonus action.
{@b {@i Fleet of Foot (4).}} Your speed for this turn is doubled.
{@b {@i One-Two Jab (5).}} Whenever you would take the Attack action, you may make an additional attack.

{@b {@i Hit and Run (8).}} As an action, you may make a single melee weapon attack. You deal extra damage equal to 1 per 5 feet moved before making the attack. You also gain the benefits of the Mobile feat, even if you would already have it.
{@b {@i Unlocked Threshold (9).}} You gain the benefits of the Haste spell until the end of your turn.
{@b {@i Action Surge (15).}} On your turn, you can take one additional action.
{@b {@i Second Wind (15).}} Regain all uses of a class feature or a number of spell slots equal to half your level.

optionalfeature.name: Deep Breaths (DP-X)
entries: At the start of your turn, you gain 3 Adrenaline. You do not gain this benefit if you are unconscious.

optionalfeature.name: Aight, Bet (AB-X)
entries: Whenever you make an attack roll, you can choose to give yourself disadvantage for the attack. If the attack hits, you gain Adrenaline equal to your proficiency bonus.

optionalfeature.name: Triggerhappy (TH-X)
entries: Whenever you land an attack roll, you gain 1 Adrenaline.

optionalfeature.name: Elysium (EY-X)
entries: On your turns, you can use an action to gain 5 Adrenaline, a bonus action to gain 2 Adrenaline, or a reaction to gain 2 Adrenaline.

optionalfeature.name: Thrillseeker (TS-X)
entries: Whenever you take damage, you gain 2 Adrenaline.

optionalfeature.name: Gravity Pull
entries: A rift in space appears at the landing point of your spell and emits a strong pulling effect. Choose a number of creatures equal to your proficiency bonus affected by your spell, they must make a Strength saving throw. On a failure, they take force damage equal to half of your sorcerer level (rounded up) and are restrained until the start of your next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Spatial Pull
entries: Two rifts in space form and are linked with one another. You can choose either one creature affected by your spell or yourself and then an empty space within 30 feet of your spell's location, the creature must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failure, they are teleported to the point of your choosing. A creature can willingly fail this save.

optionalfeature.name: Solidify Space
entries: Once per turn until the end of this spell's duration, whenever you make a jump you may compress a point of space directly under you, allowing you to make an immovable platform that you can stand on. This lasts until the end of your next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Ascendants' Knowledge
entries: You are able to decipher any written text immediately as you read them. Any words that you speak may be changed into any language that you choose and is then cleanly translated as you say them. In addition to this, you gain resistances to Words of Power that you speak or those that may affect you.

optionalfeature.name: Vacuum
entries: In addition to the AC bonus given by {@spell shield}, you add your proficiency bonus to your AC as well. The spell's effect lasts until the first attack you mitigate, in which, you absorb half of the damage that the attack would make into temporary hit points.

optionalfeature.name: Slinging With Portals
entries: While the affected object is mid-propulsion, you may summon a small portal directly on it to transport it to another area within the spell's casting range. The object regains its initial velocity and you may choose what direction it launches after teleporting.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus whenever you use this cosmic spell interaction.

optionalfeature.name: Call of the Conjurer's Constellations
entries: You imprint the chosen animal's constellation onto the affected creatures and manifest a semi-ethereal form of that creature that binds itself to them. This manifestation has AC 11 + your proficiency bonus, hit points equal to your level, and immunity to all conditions. If it has to make a saving throw, it uses your saving throw bonus for the roll. It uses your ability scores when making an attack roll, ability check, or saving throw. At the end of the affected creature's turn, they can choose a creature within 5 feet of them and the manifestation can make an attack against the target.

items: {@b {@i Bear.}} The affected creature adds +1 to their AC and they gain 2d6 temporary hit points at the start of their turn. When the Bear makes an attack, it deals 1d8 slashing damage.

{@b {@i Bull.}} Whenever the affected creature uses their action to Dash, they add 10 more feet to their movement. When the Bull makes an attack, it deals 1d10 bludgeoning damage. If the affected creature dashes during their turn, the Bull deals an additional 5 bludgeoning damage with the attack and pushes the target up to 10 feet away if they are not two sizes larger than the affected creature.

{@b {@i Cat.}} The affected creature has climbing speed equal to their movement speed. Once per turn, whenever they make a long or high jump, they can roll a d8 and add the number rolled to the number of feet they cover. This extra distance does not add to the cost of movement. When the Cat makes an attack, it deals 1d4 slashing damage.
{@b {@i Eagle.}} The affected creature has a flying speed of 30 feet. When the Eagle makes an attack, it deals 1d4 slashing damage.
{@b {@i Fox.}} The affected creature can make 2 knowledge checks per turn. When the Fox makes an attack, it deals 1d4 slashing damage.
{@b {@i Owl.}} The affected creature has a flying speed of 15 feet. Additionally, the affected creature gains darkvision, blindsight, and tremorsense reaching up to 30 feet.

optionalfeature.name: Cosmic Weapon
entries: You infuse the weapon with the power of the cosmos. The spell no longer requires concentration. Additionally, the affected weapons deals an additional 1d6 radiant damage on a hit, increasing in number of die whenever upcasted (2d6 on +2, 3d6 on +3).

optionalfeature.name: Vigor of the Void's Maw
entries: The first time you would hit in a turn using the Shadow Blade, you regain hit points equal to half of the damage dealt in a single attack. Attacks made using the Shadow Blade is both counted as a weapon and a spell attack.

optionalfeature.name: Arsenal of the Spectrum Array
entries: The weapon evoked from Flame Blade can take on various elements and shapes, which you can change every time you would evoke it. Whenever you alter the element of the weapon, you can choose any damage type except for slashing, bludgeoning, piercing, and force. Whenever you alter the Flame Blade's shape, choose any simple or martial melee weapon and it takes on the properties of the weapon chosen. Attacks made using the weapon evoked from Flame Blade is both counted as a weapon and a spell attack.

optionalfeature.name: Not-So-Minute Meteor
entries: When you cast the spell, rather than expending one or two meteors, you instead converge all of the tiny meteors you conjure into one and launch it as you normally would. The total area of effect starts with 10 feet, increasing by 5 feet per meteor. Each creature within the area of effect must make a Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes 2d6 fire damage per meteor on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. Afterwards, the meteor shatters into tinier pieces, keeping half of the total amount that was originally conjured.

optionalfeature.name: Coddled By The Clouds
entries: For the spell's duration you are considered to be affected by the effects of the spell but you do not fall unconscious and instead your movement is reduced to 0.Â In addition, all creatures affected by the spell take on a Gaseous Form (like the spell of the same name) and any healing given to them is increased by your Charisma modifier.

optionalfeature.name: Void's Night
entries: Your spell saps out all life and color from all that this light touches. The range of light conjured from this spell is reduced to 15 feet of bright light and 15 additional feet of dim light and can only be assigned to a point you choose. When a creature enters the spell's area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there, it must make a Constitution saving throw. It takes 2d6 necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. Any time necrotic damage is dealt to a creature within this area, you gain temporary hit points equal to half of the damage dealt.

optionalfeature.name: Fey's Light
entries: Your spell instills and enchants any semblance of the arcane under its light. The range of light conjured from this spell is reduced to 15 feet of bright light and 15 additional feet of dim light and can only be assigned to a point you choose. When a creature casts a spell from within the area, they gain an increase to their spell's attack, damage, and healing rolls by your Charisma modifier, and if the spell they cast requires a saving throw to be made, the DC is increased by half. In addition to this, any creature that casts a spell from within the area must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, it suffers one point of exhaustion. The light and any levels of exhaustion caused by this spell go away when the spell ends.

optionalfeature.name: High-Gravity Sphere
entries: In addition to the spell's normal effects, any creature within the sphere must spend 2 feet of movement for every 1 foot it moves when moving inside of it. Each time you would deal damage through this spell's lightning strike, the target creature must make a Strength saving throw. On a failed save, they are knocked prone.

optionalfeature.name: Interdimensional Doors
entries: When you cast this spell, you can instead teleport to a door in any plane of existence as long as it is somewhere you or the creature that you are bringing along can visualize, and the door and its frame is 80% intact. You can specify which side you emerge out of.

optionalfeature.name: Origin
entries: You add two new material options for the spell: Space Fabric, and Stardust. Both materials are indestructible and lasts for a week. Space fabric is free-flowing and flexible yet cohesive making it an ideal universal material, while Stardust is incredibly dense yet as light as a feather, making it ideal to be used in place of metals.

optionalfeature.name: Losna the Traveler
entries: Rather than manifesting the spirit of a dragon, you can instead manifest the spirit of Losna the Traveler. This spirit is Huge, has resistances to all damage types available in the spell, doubled the base hit points, and can move through any surface. Losna's Manifestation also gains a way to use its action in which it devours a willing creature that is smaller than its size. Losna's Manifestation's insides is effectively the same as the spell leomund's tiny hut. Any creature of your choice can exit and enter Losna's Manifestation by expending 5 feet of their movement right next to it.

optionalfeature.name: Accursed Anvil
entries: You know if an object, or a creature is cursed if it is within 60 feet of you. Additionally, you learn a ritual to convert magical items into their cursed variant. You perform this ritual over the course of 24 hours and the cost of the materials needed for it changes according to its rarity. You follow these rules:

items: Common magic items require a cost of 100 gold pieces.
Uncommon magic items require you to be a 5th level warlock and a cost of 1000 gold pieces.
Rare magic items require you to be a 9th level warlock and a cost of 10000 gold pieces.
Very magic items require you to be a 13th level warlock and a cost of 25000 gold pieces.
Legendary magic items require you to be a 17th level warlock and a cost of 100000 gold pieces.
You cannot conduct the ritual on artifacts and sentient magic items.

optionalfeature.name: Eldritch Burst
entries: Being within 5 feet of a hostile creature doesn't impose disadvantage on your Eldritch Blast attack rolls.

optionalfeature.name: Empowered Familiar
entries: Your familiar's maximum hit points increases to 3 + 3 times your warlock level. Additionally, your familiar adds your proficiency bonus to any attack rolls and skill checks it is already proficient in.

optionalfeature.name: Brutish Blast
entries: When you hit a creature with eldritch blast, you can choose between dealing force damage or one of the following damage types: bludgeoning, piercing, or slashing.

optionalfeature.name: Chromatic Blast
entries: When taking this eldritch invocation, choose a damage type from the following: acid, cold, fire, lightning, or thunder. When you hit a creature with eldritch blast, you can choose between dealing force damage or the chosen damage type.
This eldritch invocation can be learnt multiple times.

optionalfeature.name: Echoing of the Talisman
entries: You can establish telepathic communication between yourself and the wearer of your talisman.

optionalfeature.name: Fatal Blast
entries: At the start of your action when you cast Eldritch Blast, you can choose to take a -5 penalty to one attack roll per turn. If the attack hits, you add +10 to the damage for that attack.

optionalfeature.name: Nobody Expects the Spider Inquisition
entries: When you kill a creature, a swarm of spiders bursts from its corpse. The swarm has the same statistics as a {@creature swarm of spiders|MM|normal spider swarm}, except that you add your warlock level to its hit points and the save DC for its poison. The swarm is entirely under your mental control, and fights as you direct it. Commanding the swarm is a free action. The swarm remains for a number of rounds equal to your warlock level or until it is destroyed. The swarm can take only a standard action in the round when it emerges.

optionalfeature.name: Earned Experience
entries: You can cast the {@spell identify} spell at will, without expending a spell slot or material components.

optionalfeature.name: Witchblade
entries: When you attack with your pact weapon, you can use your Charisma modifier, instead of Strength or Dexterity, for the attack and damage rolls.

optionalfeature.name: Breadth of the Chain Master
entries: When you summon a familiar as an action, you can choose it to be enlarged or reduced as per the enlarge/reduce spell for 1 minute.

optionalfeature.name: Haunting Guard
entries: You can create your pact weapon as a bonus action.
You can use your action to don a pact armor. You can choose the form that this suit of armor takes each time you create it. You are proficient with it while you are wearing it.

Your pact armor disappears if it is more than 5 feet away from you for 1 minute or more. It also disappears if you use this feature again, if you dismiss the armor (no action required), or if you die.

You can transform one magic suit of armor into your pact armor by performing a special ritual while you don it. You perform the ritual over the course of 1 hour, which can be done during a short rest. You can then dismiss the suit of armor, shunting it into an extradimensional space, and it appears whenever you don your pact armor thereafter. You can't affect an artifact or a sentient suit of armor in this way. The suit of armor ceases being your pact armor if you die, if you perform the 1-hour ritual on a different suit of armor, or if you use a 1-hour ritual to break your bond to it. The suit of armor appears at your feet if it is in the extradimensional space when the bond breaks.

optionalfeature.name: Otherworldly Blast
entries: When taking this eldritch invocation, choose a damage type from the following: necrotic, psychic, or radiant. When you hit a creature with eldritch blast, you can choose between dealing force damage or the chosen damage type.
This eldritch invocation can be learnt multiple times.

optionalfeature.name: Riting in Taboo
entries: While the Book of Shadows is in your person, when you cast a warlock spell as a ritual, you can use the spell's normal casting time, rather than adding 10 minutes to it. Once you use this benefit, you can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Shackled Only By One
entries: As a bonus action, you can teleport up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space that you can see. You can use this bonus action only if you haven't moved during this turn, and after you use the bonus action, your speed is 0 until the end of the current turn.

optionalfeature.name: Whetting Night
entries: If the base damage dice for your pact weapon is lesser, the damage dice for it turns into a 1d10 (1d12 if it is a two-handed weapon or a versatile weapon wielded with two hands).

optionalfeature.name: Darker Diablerie
entries: You can use your Book of Shadows as a spellcasting focus for your Warlock spells, and while holding your Book of Shadows you gain a +1 bonus to spell attack rolls and to the saving throw DCs of your warlock spells.
In addition, you can regain one warlock spell slot as an action while holding the book. You can't use this property again until you finish a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Glossary of Whispers
entries: A new page appears in your Book of Shadows, written in it are otherworldly secrets that is tailored to your wants and benefits. After a long rest, choose a Mental ability score for the glossary to cater to. While the book is on your person, you gain proficiency in all skills tied to the chosen ability score and your proficiency bonus is doubled for skill checks tied to your tool proficiencies.

optionalfeature.name: Grip of the Chain Master
entries: When you cast find familiar, your familiar can take on new forms to assist you in combat. When choosing familiars that are not within the standard ruling, you follow these {@filter rules|bestiary|Challenge Rating=[&0;&5]|type=!humanoid|miscellaneous=!adventure npc;!spellcaster;!reprinted|size=t;s;m}:

items: Casting the spell requires an additional hour and 100 gp per CR of the monster.
Your familiar can have a challenge rating no greater than 1/4th of your warlock level rounded down.
Your familiar cannot be a Humanoid creature.
Your familiar cannot be larger than Large.
Your familiar cannot cast spells.

entries: Additionally, your familiars now how have the following benefits:

items: Your familiar can attack in combat.
If the form of your familiar has an Intelligence of 5 or less, its Intelligence becomes 6, and it gains the ability to understand one language of your choice that you speak.

optionalfeature.name: Inexorable Occult
entries: Whenever you hit with a melee attack, you can channel a single beam of the eldritch blast spell onto the same target. You cannot target the same creature with this feature more than once per turn.

optionalfeature.name: Intimacy of the Chain Master
entries: While your familiar is within 100 feet of you, you can use your action to teleport to its space or a space within 5 feet of it.

optionalfeature.name: Inverted Gaze
entries: You cannot be surprised even if you are unconscious, and you immediately become aware that a creature is looking at you using their eyes.

optionalfeature.name: Judgement Through Selfish Lenses
entries: When creating a talisman, you can create it either as a {@item Talisman of Pure Good|DMG} or a {@item Talisman of Ultimate Evil|DMG}. The bonus to spell attack rolls extends the benefit to anyone that can wear it and it has no charges for banishment.

optionalfeature.name: Link of the Chain Master
entries: While your familiar is within 100 feet of you, you can cast any spell as if you are in your familiar's space.

optionalfeature.name: Witchstroll
entries: Your movement is unaffected by difficult terrain, and spells and other magical effects that can reduce the your speed.

optionalfeature.name: Closed Eyes, Open Mind
entries: You have blindsight and tremorsense within a range of 30 feet.

optionalfeature.name: Eidolon Legacy
entries: Spirits that you manifest using Summon spells are counted as a familiar which you can have alongside your familiar and gains benefits that affect your familiars.
The spells eligible for this effect are the following: {@spell summon fey|TCE}, {@spell summon shadowspawn|TCE}, {@spell summon undead|TCE}, {@spell summon aberration|TCE}, {@spell summon fiend|TCE}.

optionalfeature.name: Fugitive's Asylum
entries: The talisman gains an additional benefit when worn. These benefits are the following:

items: You are immune to contracting any disease while you wear this talisman. If you are already infected with a disease, the effects of the disease are suppressed while you wear the talisman.
You stabilize whenever you are dying at the start of your turn. In addition, whenever you roll a Hit Die to regain hit points, double the number of hit points it restores.
You gain the benefits of the {@spell aid} spell, with the spell slot level being equal to the warlock's spell slot level.

optionalfeature.name: Hyperactive Discharge
entries: You can cast eldritch blast as a bonus action or on additional actions gained from effects such as the haste spell. When cast this way, you only channel a single beam from this casting.

optionalfeature.name: Orders of the Chain Master
entries: The talisman gains an additional benefit when worn. These benefits are the following:

items: You can cast one of the following spells: {@spell ashardalon's stride|FTD}, {@spell dragon's breath|XGE}, {@spell flame blade}, {@spell haste}, {@spell invisibility}, {@spell shadow blade}, {@spell spirit shroud|TCE}, {@spell vampiric touch}; without expending a spell slot or material components. Casting a spell this way affects only your familiar, even if it is a Self-ranged spell. You regain the use of this feature after you finish a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Safeguarding of the Talisman
entries: The talisman gains an additional benefit when worn:

items: When you are reduced to 0 hit points but not killed outright, you can drop to 1 hit point instead and cause all hostile creatures that are Large-sized or smaller to be pushed 10 feet away from you and take necrotic damage equal to the last instance of damage you took. You can't use this feature again until the warlock finishes a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Soldier of the Chain Master
entries: While your familiar is within 30 feet of you, it gains the following benefits:

items: Your familiar regain hit points equal to your warlock level at the start of its turn as long as it is not unconscious.
Its attacks now count as magical for the purpose of overcoming resistance and immunity to nonmagical damage.
You add your proficiency bonus to its armor class, damage rolls, and saving throws.

optionalfeature.name: Fetters of the Chain Master
entries: You can have two familiars at once instead of one.

optionalfeature.name: Hell's Smithy
entries: You can have a number of pact weapons equal to your proficiency bonus. If you perform the 1-hour ritual on another weapon when you have already reached your maximum amount, you break the bond with the earliest weapon you are currently bonded to. If you have the Haunting Guard eldritch invocation, it gains the same benefits and is tracked separately.
You can manifest two of your pact weapons whenever you take an action to create them and you have two empty hands.

optionalfeature.name: Sacrilegous Sortilege
entries: Spells that you can cast through an eldritch invocation is added to your spell list. For any invocations that grant the use of a spell once per long rest, you can now cast them without expending a spell slot once per long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Twinned Talismans
entries: Your patron gifts you with the ability to create a second talisman, which can be given to a second wearer. While you have two active talismans, each talisman may be used by its wearer a number of times equal to half your proficiency bonus, rounded up, and all expended uses are restored when you finish a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Arcanum Born From Anathema
entries: You may add a second 6th-level Mystic Arcanum spell to your spell list. You may cast each of your 6th-level Mystic Arcanum spells once per long rest. Additionally, you may use your 6th level Mystic Arcanum to cast a warlock spell you know of 5th level or lower at 6th level.

optionalfeature.name: Eldritch Ravager
entries: When you channel a beam from eldritch blast, it targets all creatures of your choosing within 20 feet. It shares the same attack and damage rolls for all targets.

optionalfeature.name: Focus Within Shared Shackles
entries: While your familiar is within 60 feet of you, you can maintain concentration on a second spell. If you or your familiar takes damage, you make concentration checks to maintain both spells. If your familiar reaches 0 hit points, your concentration automatically fails on both spells.

optionalfeature.name: Sorcery's Pariah
entries: You learn the {@spell dispel magic} spell and the {@spell counterspell} spell. You have a number of free uses shared between the two spells equal to your proficiency bonus and regain all uses on a long rest.
When you cast the dispel magic spell, it has the following benefits:

items: You can target two creatures, objects, or magical effects within range.
The target has disadvantage on the next Constitution saving throw that they make to maintain concentration on a spell.
You can deal force damage equal to your warlock level on a target whose effects are dispelled.
